title: Wanted: Dead or Dead

messages.subject: Puppy for sale
comments: Tommy attaches (or should that be attack?!) photos of his puppy, obviously ripped from some internet site. Note that these picture are actual size:
messages.body:
my is clement i am from barrytown(new york) but due to work
presntly i was just been transfered about couple of days for a missionary
purpose in west africa.right now i am still located in republic
of benin where am carrying out my missionary assignment and due
to tight assignment i found myself i don't have much time to take
good care of my puppy like i use to,and so also the environment
that the puppy found her self here in republic of benin is too harsh.
therefore have decided to give out the puppy to a good caring person
that would treat my puppy with a tender care and a well family interraction.
the puppy is well breed and the puppy has a current vaccination,vet
exams,health certificate and 1year guarantee.the puppy has potty
trained,home raise and socialized for tremendious attitude.well
and excellent temparamented.the puppy has super trainability and
people pleasing personality.the puppy is given a high learning a
delight elegance of structure and well dewormed.the dog has C.K.C,A.K.C
and F.C.I Registered.am offering the puppy out at $650 each one
including the shipment.and i have attack the pics of my puppy, and
i will like to attach the pic of mine self.
i will like to hear from you as soon as possible.Thanks AND
GOD BLESS.
messages.raw:
From: Tommy Mark
To: Arthur Dent
Date: February 25, 2006
Subject: Puppy for sale

my is clement i am from barrytown(new york) but due to work presntly i was just been transfered about couple of days for a missionary purpose in west africa.right now i am still located in republic of benin where am carrying out my missionary assignment and due to tight assignment i found myself i don't have much time to take good care of my puppy like i use to,and so also the environment that the puppy found her self here in republic of benin is too harsh. therefore have decided to give out the puppy to a good caring person that would treat my puppy with a tender care and a well family interraction.

the puppy is well breed and the puppy has a current vaccination,vet exams,health certificate and 1year guarantee.the puppy has potty trained,home raise and socialized for tremendious attitude.well and excellent temparamented.the puppy has super trainability and people pleasing personality.the puppy is given a high learning a delight elegance of structure and well dewormed.the dog has C.K.C,A.K.C and F.C.I Registered.am offering the puppy out at $650 each one including the shipment.and i have attack the pics of my puppy, and i will like to attach the pic of mine self.

i will like to hear from you as soon as possible.Thanks AND GOD BLESS.

Tommy attaches (or should that be attack?!) photos of his puppy, obviously ripped from some internet site. Note that these picture are actual size:

Arthur Dent

messages.body:
I only deal in dead dogs, sorry. It costs more to import them alive.

I own an exotic food importation company specialising in Klingon
foodstuffs. We usually pay between $2,000 to $3,500 per kilo for
fresh dog meat, antelope meat, tribble meat and also, Mogwai meat.

Thank you for your contact and I am sorry you cannot help me at
this time.

Arthur Dent
Director
Klingon Meat Trading
messages.raw:
From: Arthur Dent
To: Tommy Mark
Date: February 26, 2006

I only deal in dead dogs, sorry. It costs more to import them alive.

I own an exotic food importation company specialising in Klingon foodstuffs. We usually pay between $2,000 to $3,500 per kilo for fresh dog meat, antelope meat, tribble meat and also, Mogwai meat.

Thank you for your contact and I am sorry you cannot help me at this time.

Arthur Dent
Director
Klingon Meat Trading

messages.body:
Do you have dealers who also specialise in Mogwai meat? I recently
lost my usual supplier and am in desperate need of a new and reliable
supplier. Typically for good quality imported Mogwai meat my company
pay $2,700 per kilo (that is for the smoked Mogwai meat). I would
be very interested in importing regular supplies if you are able
to arrange this.

Get back to me with more information and prices if possible and
let me know a list of the different type of meats you can export
to me.

Arthur Dent.
Director
Klingon Trading Ltd.
messages.raw:
From: Arthur Dent
To: Tommy Mark
Date: February 26, 2006

Do you have dealers who also specialise in Mogwai meat? I recently lost my usual supplier and am in desperate need of a new and reliable supplier. Typically for good quality imported Mogwai meat my company pay $2,700 per kilo (that is for the smoked Mogwai meat). I would be very interested in importing regular supplies if you are able to arrange this.

Get back to me with more information and prices if possible and let me know a list of the different type of meats you can export to me.

Arthur Dent.
Director
Klingon Trading Ltd.

messages.subject: Re: Puppy for sale
messages.body:
Yes i have a dealer who specialised in Mogwai meat,i spoke to
him concerning supplying your company as you request.He export the
smoke and unsmoke mogwai meat at the rate of $2,550 per kilos.
He has different kind of meats he export to its customers.
Reply as soon as possible
Thanks and God Bless.

He has different kind of meats he export to its customers.

Reply as soon as possible

Thanks and God Bless.

messages.body:
Dear Mr. Clement,

My apologies for the slight delay in replying to you. I have been
meeting with a prospective client in Xanadu and only returned to
my office a short while ago.

I would be very interested indeed in purchasing regular supplies
of Mogwai meat however as your dealer will of course know I will
require an exportation certificate from the country of origin, and
medical 'fit for consumption' certificate which shows the Mogwai
meat is fit for human consumption. Without such certificates I will
not be allowed to import them in the UK. If your supplier is able
to provide me with these certificates then I see no reason why we
cannot do much business together. For my first order I would be
prepared to take 95 kilos.

Please get back to me as soon as possible, also please give me your
prices on the puppy meat that you said you could get for me.

Sincerely.

Arthur Dent
Director
Klingon Trading
messages.raw:
From: Arthur Dent
To: Tommy Mark
Date: February 28, 2006

Dear Mr. Clement,

My apologies for the slight delay in replying to you. I have been meeting with a prospective client in Xanadu and only returned to my office a short while ago.

I would be very interested indeed in purchasing regular supplies of Mogwai meat however as your dealer will of course know I will require an exportation certificate from the country of origin, and medical 'fit for consumption' certificate which shows the Mogwai meat is fit for human consumption. Without such certificates I will not be allowed to import them in the UK. If your supplier is able to provide me with these certificates then I see no reason why we cannot do much business together. For my first order I would be prepared to take 95 kilos.

Please get back to me as soon as possible, also please give me your prices on the puppy meat that you said you could get for me.

Sincerely.

Arthur Dent
Director
Klingon Trading

UNIT FEMMARD FOOD BENNE

DATE 29TH MAY 2000
DEAR CUTOMER

CERTIFICATE OF IN CORPORATION
TO WHOM IT MAY CONCERD
THIS IS TO CERTIFY THAT FEMMARD FOOD HAS BEEN REGISTERED AS

COMMISSION.
THIS IS THE ONLY CERTIFICATE THAT ANY BUYER OF LIVESTOCK CAN
BE ISSUED WHEN BUYING FROM US IN R/BENIN.
FAMMARD

messages.body:
Dear Sir,

Thank you for your email, however a livestock importation certificate
is of no use to me. I do not wish to import livestock, I wish to
import deadstock.

Thank you again for your email however I shall have to search for
an alternative supplier.

Sincerely.

Arthur Dent
Director
Klingon Trading

messages.body:
Dear Sir,

Thank you for your reply and it is good to learn that you also deal
with deadstock. Please do not forget to send me a list of the deadstock
that you deal in. We would be interested in the following deadstock:

Antelope
Lesser Spotted Gibbon
African Squawk Deer
Camel Humps
Kangaroo
Chucklefish
Three footed horseferret
Mancunian Haggis
Mogwai
Elephant Wings
Herbian Dog Liver
Albanian Cheese Hedgehog

If you have stock of any of the above meat products I would be very
interested, and also if you supply any other types of meat products
then please do let me know, along with the prices per kilo.

Regarding importing your products into the UK. I will need from
you a clearance/importation certificate for each meat type. The
UK C&E will not allow me to import meat from a foreign country
without this certificate. I cannot explain to you the exact contents
of the certificate because of course each country has a different
type, however the certificate will come from your country's exportation
department and have the meat product named and clearance that the
meat is safe for exportation and for human consumption.

I do not know if you have exported meat products to the UK before
but if not then please let me know and I can show you an example
of the type of import certificate we need.

Sincerely.

Arthur Dent
Director
Klingon Trading
messages.raw:
From: Arthur Dent
To: Lewis Seth
Date: March 2, 2006

Dear Sir,

Thank you for your reply and it is good to learn that you also deal with deadstock. Please do not forget to send me a list of the deadstock that you deal in. We would be interested in the following deadstock:

Antelope
Lesser Spotted Gibbon
African Squawk Deer
Camel Humps
Kangaroo
Chucklefish
Three footed horseferret
Mancunian Haggis
Mogwai
Elephant Wings
Herbian Dog Liver
Albanian Cheese Hedgehog

If you have stock of any of the above meat products I would be very interested, and also if you supply any other types of meat products then please do let me know, along with the prices per kilo.

Regarding importing your products into the UK. I will need from you a clearance/importation certificate for each meat type. The UK C&E will not allow me to import meat from a foreign country without this certificate. I cannot explain to you the exact contents of the certificate because of course each country has a different type, however the certificate will come from your country's exportation department and have the meat product named and clearance that the meat is safe for exportation and for human consumption.

I do not know if you have exported meat products to the UK before but if not then please let me know and I can show you an example of the type of import certificate we need.

Sincerely.

Arthur Dent
Director
Klingon Trading

messages.body:
Dear Mr. Seth,
The date on the certificate is February 2005. Did you know that
we are now in May 2006 (TWO THOUSAND AND SIX)?

Deadstock certificates are only valid in the UK for SIX WEEKS after
they have been presented.

Your certificate is totally useless to me.
Arthur Dent
Director
Klingon Trading

To: Lewis Seth

notes: I express an interest in Tommy's puppies, but not in the way he thinks.
Seems that Tommy can supply dog meat after all. What a surprise!
It seems Mogwai meat is definitely on the menu.
Before I even contact Tommy's recommended company, they get in touch with me. Apparently his "certificate" is in the form of a couple of sentences in an email!
I send Lewis a sample of a deadstock importation certificate.
Tommy Mark gets in touch. He's obviously been "talking" with Lewis!
A few days later it appears my certificate are ready.
Lewis seems to think he's getting payment up front. What a deranged fellow he is.
A week goes by and eventually Lewis gets back in touch. I suspect he thinks I may have forgotten about the certificates? Lewis is obviously mentally retarded.
WARNING: Bad language alert!
Just as I send the above email. My phone rings:
March 18, 2006: Lewis Seth (and I presume Tommy Mark) - 1meg MP3
The guys got frustrated (as did I), putting the phone down on me twice!
Incredibly, after the call above, and after they have received my previous email, I received an exact copy of their last email.
I decide to give a short and sweet answer.
Looks like this bait is going nowhere.
Nine days go by and nothing to show for it. I decide to contact Tommy Mark's alter-ego, Lewis Seth.
Amazingly, Lewis sends ANOTHER request for payment!
The smell of money brings Seth out.
Hurrah! The certificate finally arrives. Are you all excited? I hope not!
To be continued...?
Sadly not. This particular pair of idiots never did get back to me, which is a great pity as they were definitely comedy gold, and I was so looking forward to more sparkling telephone conversation.
END.
